Detailed Description

This implements the learning part of the Softmax (aka multinomial logistic or multinomial logit) regression.

It's a generalization of the binary Sigmoid regression for multiclass cases.

Given a discrete class variable with modalities, and a set of quantitative attribute variables , the Softmax regression assumes that

and

This leads to the recursive formula:

in which

The learning algorithm computes the parameter matrix using an iterative algorithm (newton-raphson). Thus, unlike the other learning objects, plLearnSoftmax is not incremental and needs to store all the data points added using plLearnObject::add_point().

See Also
plSoftmax
plLearnNoisyOR

plLearnSoftmax::plLearnSoftmax ( const plSymbol &  left_var,
const plVariablesConjunction &  right_vars,
plFloat  conv_threshold = 0.00001,
plFloat  inv_threshold = 0.001 
)

Constructor.

Parameters
[in]left_varThe class variable
[in]right_varsThe quantitative attribute parent variables
[in]conv_thresholdThe convergence threshold to be used for the newton-raphson algorithm
[in]inv_thresholdThe threshold used for Greville's algorithm used for the Hessian matrix inversion

Member Function Documentation

plCndDistribution plLearnSoftmax::get_cnd_distribution ( ) const
virtual

Constructs the corresponding learnt distribution.

It computes the matrix using an iterative algorithm (newton-raphson) and returns a plSoftmax with the computed .

Implements plLearnCndObject.

unsigned int plLearnSoftmax::get_n_parameters ( ) const
virtual

Returns the ACTUAL number of parameters.

It could be different from the number of parameters returned by get_parameters.

For example, the actual number of parameters of a N dimensional normal distribution is N + N*(N+1)/2 because the covariance matrix is symmetric.

Implements plLearnObject.
